descriptionMarkdown:
An abomination. It should be burned out of existence with fire...

But, despite that:

Oil, water, petroleum, light oil, and heavy oil pipes are all properly separated from one another, whilst connecting 100% of their own type of pipe into a single fluid network. This means that you can tile this however you want, provide oil/water to it ANYWHERE, and extract petroleum/heavy oil/light oil ANYWHERE (as long as you plug in to the correct pipe type).

So, tile it down wherever you want, connect oil and water and then connect a place to send your light/heavy/petroleum (probably a good idea to toss an underground->pump->storage tank as your connector). 

Pipes below bottom-most {standard orientation} refinery can be largely* cut away [or never actually placed], but won't cause problems if placed and left.

*don't cut away the water/oil connections and their loopback [unless you want to make the bottom-most refinery useless], but you can cut the "continue sending farther" section of them, as well as all the product-oil pipes in that area.


-

Assuming you tiled "too big", just deconstruct everything that's beyond your boundary of "too big" and then deconstruct whatever refineries are rendered nonfunctional and piping.

\-\-\-\-\-

If you only have one oil input, and output all products in one corner, if you tile this monster beyond a certain point it is NOT going to actually improve your oil refining rate due to fluid flow rates. It is theoretically possible to tile this 999999999x99999999 times, and in theory everything is connected and works, but Factorio's fluid flow mechanics will laugh at you and a lot of the refineries will sit there idle and complaining about an ingredient shortage. For good reason. Beyond a certain size you'll need to provide additional oil (and water!) inputs--preferably in different locations, not one corner--and/or add some pumps into the design [entirely possible, but requires knowledge of how that specific setup is going to function that I obviously don't have].
title: SIR - Shiverczar's Infinite Refinery
